<extra_id_0> Beta-catenin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> is the vertebrate homolog of the Drosophila segment polarity gene Armadillo and plays roles in both cell-cell adhesion and transduction of the Wnt signaling cascade .

Recently , members of the Lef / Tcf transcription factor family have been identified as protein partners of <extra_id_0> beta-catenin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , explaining how <extra_id_0> beta-catenin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> alters gene expression .

Here we report that in T cells , <extra_id_0> Tcf-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> also becomes transcriptionally active through interaction with <extra_id_0> beta-catenin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , suggesting that the Wnt signal transduction pathway is operational in T lymphocytes as well .

text: However , although Wnt signals are known to inhibit the activity of the negative regulatory protein kinase <extra_id_0> glycogen synthase kinase-3beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> GSK-3beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) , resulting in increased levels of <extra_id_0> beta-catenin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , we find no evidence for involvement of <extra_id_0> GSK-3beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> in Tcf - mediated transcription in T cells .

text: That is , a dominant negative <extra_id_0> GSK-3beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> does not specifically activate Tcf transcription and stimuli ( lithium or <extra_id_0> phytohemagglutinin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) that inhibit <extra_id_0> GSK-3beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> activity also do not activate Tcf reporter genes .

text: Thus , inhibition of <extra_id_0> GSK-3beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> is insufficient to activate Tcf - dependent transcription in T lymphocytes .

In contrast , in C57MG fibroblast cells , lithium inactivates <extra_id_0> GSK-3beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and induces <extra_id_0> Tcf <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - controlled transcription .
This is the first demonstration that lithium can alter gene expression of Tcf - responsive genes , and points to a difference in regulation of Wnt signaling between fibroblasts and lymphocytes .
